entry.title: Foster-Daimler tractors (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1914 the Royal Navy acquired ninety-seven Foster-Daimler tractors (example pictured) to tow the BL 15-inch howitzer, with eight tractors required to tow each howitzer?

entry.title: KWEM-LP (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that KWEM-LP in West Memphis, Arkansas, was established as a tribute to a radio station that in the late 1940s and 1950s helped launch the careers of B.B. King, Howlin' Wolf and Johnny Cash?

entry.title: John Knight (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the slave trader John Knight transported more than 26,000 Africans to the Americas?

entry.title: Axa Equitable Center (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that for the construction of the US$200 million Axa Equitable Center, the Equitable Life Assurance Society spent $7.5 million on artwork?

entry.title: Lulwah Al-Qatami (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lulwah Al-Qatami was the first woman from Kuwait to study at a university abroad?

entry.title: canon law of the Eastern Orthodox Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some canons of the canon law of the Eastern Orthodox Church contradict each other?

entry.title: Jacquelyn Reingold (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jacquelyn Reingold knew nothing about string theory until she wrote a play about it?

entry.title: Another Body Murdered (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Another Body Murdered", a collaboration between Faith No More and Boo-Yaa T.R.I.B.E., has been described as having "a chest-puffing, smack-talking energy that’s undeniable"?
